info.title: Default title
info.description: HubSpot’s CRM is a system for managing customer relationships and storing data. The CRM custom connector provides access to CRM objects or groups of objects, which are represented as a map of property names to values.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

get.description: Return all pipelines for the object type specified by {objectType}.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

post.description: Create a new pipeline with the provided property values. The entire pipeline object, including its unique ID, will be returned in the response.

label.title: Label
label.description: A unique label used to organize pipelines in HubSpot's UI

displayOrder.title: Display order
displayOrder.description: The order for displaying this pipeline stage. If two pipeline stages have a matching displayOrder, they will be sorted alphabetically by label.

ticketState.title: Ticket State
ticketState.description: A JSON object containing properties that are not present on all object pipelines.  For deals pipelines, the probability field is required ({ "probability": 0.5 }), and represents the likelihood a deal will close. Possible values are between 0.0 and 1.0 in increments of 0.1.  For tickets pipelines, the ticketState field is optional ({ "ticketState": "OPEN" }), and represents whether the ticket remains open or has been closed by a member of your Support team. Possible values are OPEN or CLOSED.

get.description: Return a single pipeline object identified by its unique {pipelineId}.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

put.description: Replace all the properties of an existing pipeline with the values provided. This will overwrite any existing pipeline stages. The updated pipeline will be returned in the response.

label.title: Label
label.description: A label used to organize pipeline stages in HubSpot's UI. Each pipeline stage's label must be unique within that pipeline.

displayOrder.title: Display order
displayOrder.description: The order for displaying this pipeline stage. If two pipeline stages have a matching displayOrder, they will be sorted alphabetically by label.

patch.description: Perform a partial update of the pipeline identified by {pipelineId}. The updated pipeline will be returned in the response.

displayOrder.title: Display order
displayOrder.description: The order for displaying this pipeline. If two pipelines have a matching displayOrder, they will be sorted alphabetically by label.

label.title: Label
label.description: A unique label used to organize pipelines in HubSpot's UI

archived.title: Archived
archived.description: Whether the pipeline is archived. This property should only be provided when restoring an archived pipeline. If it's provided in any other call, the request will fail and a 400 Bad Request will be returned.

post.description: Create a new stage associated with the pipeline identified by {pipelineId}. The entire stage object, including its unique ID, will be returned in the response.

ticketState.title: Ticket State
ticketState.description: A JSON object containing properties that are not present on all object pipelines.  For deals pipelines, the probability field is required ({ "probability": 0.5 }), and represents the likelihood a deal will close. Possible values are between 0.0 and 1.0 in increments of 0.1.  For tickets pipelines, the ticketState field is optional ({ "ticketState": "OPEN" }), and represents whether the ticket remains open or has been closed by a member of your Support team. Possible values are OPEN or CLOSED.

displayOrder.title: Display order
displayOrder.description: The order for displaying this pipeline stage. If two pipeline stages have a matching displayOrder, they will be sorted alphabetically by label.

label.title: Label
label.description: A label used to organize pipeline stages in HubSpot's UI. Each pipeline stage's label must be unique within that pipeline.

get.description: Return the stage identified by {stageId} associated with the pipeline identified by {pipelineId}.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

delete.description: Archive the pipeline stage identified by {stageId} associated with the pipeline identified by {pipelineId}.

put.description: Replace all the properties of an existing pipeline stage with the values provided. The updated stage will be returned in the response.

ticketState.title: Ticket State
ticketState.description: A JSON object containing properties that are not present on all object pipelines.  For deals pipelines, the probability field is required ({ "probability": 0.5 }), and represents the likelihood a deal will close. Possible values are between 0.0 and 1.0 in increments of 0.1.  For tickets pipelines, the ticketState field is optional ({ "ticketState": "OPEN" }), and represents whether the ticket remains open or has been closed by a member of your Support team. Possible values are OPEN or CLOSED.

displayOrder.title: Display order
displayOrder.description: The order for displaying this pipeline stage. If two pipeline stages have a matching displayOrder, they will be sorted alphabetically by label.

label.title: Label
label.description: A label used to organize pipeline stages in HubSpot's UI. Each pipeline stage's label must be unique within that pipeline.

patch.description: Perform a partial update of the pipeline stage identified by {stageId} associated with the pipeline identified by {pipelineId}. Any properties not included in this update will keep their existing values. The updated stage will be returned in the response.

ticketState.title: Ticket State
ticketState.description: A JSON object containing properties that are not present on all object pipelines.  For deals pipelines, the probability field is required ({ "probability": 0.5 }), and represents the likelihood a deal will close. Possible values are between 0.0 and 1.0 in increments of 0.1.  For tickets pipelines, the ticketState field is optional ({ "ticketState": "OPEN" }), and represents whether the ticket remains open or has been closed by a member of your Support team. Possible values are OPEN or CLOSED.

displayOrder.title: Display order
displayOrder.description: The order for displaying this pipeline stage. If two pipeline stages have a matching displayOrder, they will be sorted alphabetically by label.

label.title: Label
label.description: A label used to organize pipeline stages in HubSpot's UI. Each pipeline stage's label must be unique within that pipeline.

get.description: Read all existing properties for the specified object type and HubSpot account.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

post.description: Create and return a copy of a new property for the specified object type.

groupName.title: Group Name
groupName.description: The name of the property group the property belongs to.

hidden.description: If true, the property won't be visible and can't be used in HubSpot.
hidden.title: hidden

displayOrder.title: Display order
displayOrder.description: Properties are displayed in order starting with the lowest positive integer value. Values of -1 will cause the property to be displayed after any positive values.

label.title: Label
label.description: A human-readable option label that will be shown in HubSpot.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of the property that will be shown as help text in HubSpot.

value.title: Value
value.description: The internal value of the option, which must be used when setting the property value through the API.

displayOrder.title: Display order
displayOrder.description: Properties are displayed in order starting with the lowest positive integer value. Values of -1 will cause the property to be displayed after any positive values.

hidden.description: Hidden options won't be shown in HubSpot.
hidden.title: option hidden

label.title: Label
label.description: A human-readable property label that will be shown in HubSpot.

hasUniqueValue.description: Whether or not the property's value must be unique. Once set, this can't be changed.
hasUniqueValue.title: hasUniqueValue

type.description: The data type of the property.
type.title: type

fieldType.description: Controls how the property appears in HubSpot.
fieldType.title: fieldType

formField.description: Whether or not the property can be used in a HubSpot form.
formField.title: formField

get.description: Return a list of line items. Control what is returned via the properties query param.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.
parameters.x-ms-summary: The maximum number of results to display per page.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored.
parameters.x-ms-summary: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored.

parameters.name: associations
parameters.description: A comma separated list of object types to retrieve associated IDs for. If any of the specified associations do not exist, they will be ignored.

post.description: Create a line item with the given properties and return a copy of the object, including the ID.

get.description: Read a lite item identified by {lineItemId}. {lineItemId} refers to the internal object ID by default, or optionally any unique property value as specified by the idProperty query param. Control what is returned via the properties query param.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored.
parameters.x-ms-summary: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored.

parameters.name: associations
parameters.description: A comma separated list of object types to retrieve associated IDs for. If any of the specified associations do not exist, they will be ignored.
parameters.x-ms-summary: A comma separated list of object types to retrieve associated IDs for. If any of the specified associations do not exist, they will be ignored.

parameters.name: idProperty
parameters.description: The name of a property whose values are unique for this object type
parameters.x-ms-summary: The name of a property whose values are unique for this object type

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

delete.description: Move an Object identified by {lineItemId} to the recycling bin.

patch.description: Perform a partial update of a line item identified by {lineItemId}. {lineItemId} refers to the internal object ID by default, or optionally any unique property value as specified by the idProperty query param. Provided property values will be overwritten. Read-only and non-existent properties will be ignored. Properties values can be cleared by passing an empty string.
